sentences.english: His officials administered the domains and collected the rent from the colons .
sentences.chinese: 他的手下管理領地並向佃戶收租。

sentences.english: He summoned his tenants to appear before him.
sentences.chinese: 他召集佃戶們來到他跟前。

sentences.english: The new rulers took farms from the landlords and gave them to the tenants.
sentences.chinese: 新的政府從地主手中取得了田土，並把它們分給佃戶。

sentences.english: Russia made the peasant the tenant of the state.
sentences.chinese: 俄國把農民變成了國家的佃戶。

sentences.english: Homage wasaccordinglythe acknowledgment ofthebond tenure between lord and tenant.
sentences.chinese: 效忠同樣也是對領主和佃戶之間租賃契約的確認。

sentences.english: Now they tell me that first of the tenants are to flit tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 剛纔他們告訴我，第一批的佃戶們明天就得搬走。

sentences.english: But the company can be a harsh overlord to its crofters.
sentences.chinese: 但是公司對其佃戶和工人可以作威作福，苛刻異常。

definition: funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: fig. people who cannot afford to buy their own house
Wu Sangui (1612-1678), Chinese general who let the Manchus into China and helped them establish the Qing Dynasty, later leading a revolt against Qing in an effort to start his own dynasty
Long Xing Quan - "Dragon Fist" - Martial Art
to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
to be in charge of something specific
